ARABIC: قَالَتْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَفْتُونِى فِىٓ أَمْرِى مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: She said, 'Council! give me your opinion about this matter. It is not my habit to make a final decision until I have heard what you have to say.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: ." Advise me, O nobles," she said "in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (After reading the letter) the Queen said: "Nobles, let me have your counsel in this matter for I make no firm decision without you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: She said, "My officials, what are your views on this matter? I will not decide until I have your views.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: She said, “O chieftains, advise me in this matter of mine; I do not give a final decision until you are present with me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: She said: "O chiefs! Advise me in case of mine. I decide no case till you are present with me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: She said: O chiefs! give me advice respecting my affair: I never decide an affair until you are in my presence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: She said, 'O Council, pronounce to me concerning my affair; I am not used to decide an affair until you bear me witness.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case. I decide no case till ye are present with me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Now advise me in this, Counsellors. I never decide any affair till I have conferred with you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: She said: O chiefs! counsel me in my affair. I am wont not to resolve on any affair until ye are present with me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: She said, ‘O [members of the] elite! Give me your opinion concerning my matter. I do not decide any matter until you are present.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: She said: "Ye chiefs! advise me in (this) my affair: no affair have I decided except in your presence."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: She said: "O chiefs! Advise me in (this) case of mine. I decide no case till you are present with me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: She said: 'O Council, let me hear your counsel, concerning my affairs, for I am not used to deciding an affair until you bear me witness'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: She said, “O counselors, advise me in this matter of mine. I never make a decision unless you are present.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:32] She said, ‘O [members of the] council, give me an opinion (read yā ayyuhā’l-mala’u aftūnī, pronouncing both hamzas, or by not pronouncing the second and changing it into a wāw), in other words, guide me, in this matter of mine. I never decide on a matter, I never conclude it, until you are present’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (She said: chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case) inform me about what I should do; it is also said that this means: advise me about what to do. (I decide no case) I will not do anything (till ye are present with me) and advise me.
